description: Trouville environs. Beach (as place of recreation).
marks: Signature and Date LR in brown: [E.Boudin 1864]
text: Eugène Boudin was one of the most important precursors to Impressionism. This characteristic beach scene was the first painting purchased by the Minneapolis Institute of Arts after it opened in 1915.
title: Vacationers on the Beach at Trouville
